The claim originated from President Dona: where he mentioned the potential number of deaths predicted by mathematical models if no interventions were put in place.
The figure of 2 million lives saved was: an epidemiology professor at Imperial College London, which estimated potential deaths in the US due to COVID-19 in an unmitigated epidemic.
The study did not explicitly state that: 2 million people were going to die, but rather served as a warning of the potential consequences if no preventive measures were taken.
Experts: including Justin Lessler from Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health, have expressed skepticism about the claim, stating that it is premature to say that 2 million lives have been saved since the pandemic is ongoing and people are still dying from COVID-19.
